comments.author: mtrinkala@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
The licensing fees have zero cost but they still contain the usage time and they have the same labels as compute entries so they were being summed (it looks like the rows only differ by sku id/description and the zero cost).  However, removing those from the sum only cuts the total in half. 
```
[
  {
    "date": "2020-05-18",
    "id": "4A30-9DBE-ECEA",
    "description": "Preemptible Custom Instance Core running in Americas",
    "f0_": "49",
    "cost": "118.72920299999998",
    "seconds": "6.1235723487095E7"
  },
  {
    "date": "2020-05-18",
    "id": "D2D4-1351-297C",
    "description": "Licensing Fee for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver) (CPU cost)",
    "f0_": "50",
    "cost": "0.0",
    "seconds": "6.1243578487095006E7"
  },
  {
    "date": "2020-05-18",
    "id": "A227-50BC-4E7E",
    "description": "Licensing Fee for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver) (CPU cost)",
    "f0_": "47",
    "cost": "0.0",
    "seconds": "1913630.0637939998"
  }
]
```

mtrinkala@mozilla.com
comments.text:
It looks like the seconds are scaled by the # CPUs but I cannot find anything in the billing documentation.

Opened support Case 23723094 to confirm the representation of usage.amount for this billing entry type
